pr_title: Prepares for dynamic baggage and fixes broken OSGi config

timeline.message:
Prepares for dynamic baggage

This refactors internal code around baggage so that it can handle
dynamic baggage in a single propagated field. This also removes unused
tag parsing logic in gRPC as we no longer mutate tags.

`BaggageState` is the entry in `TraceContext.extra()` that holds all
baggage, whether they are fixed or not. `BaggageStateHandler` is given
one slot and currently uses one slot per `BaggageField`. However,
`DynamicBaggageStateHandler` shows we can do multiple fields in one
slot, just we aren't doing that yet as we need to define an encoding.

timeline.bodyText:
encodeState is what Setter.set will use. I was bored, so I used property encoding in the test, but we will likely do comma, equals in real life.
This is how we can tunnel many baggage fields over one header, named for example, "baggage" or "b3ext" or whatever someone wants.

+/**
+ * Handles context storage of one or more baggage fields using one {@link ExtraBaggageFields}
+ * state.
+ *
+ * @param <S> the state that represents one or more baggage fields
+ */
+public interface BaggageHandler<S> {
+  /**
+   * When true, calls to {@link #currentFields(Object)} and {@link #handlesField(BaggageField)}
+   * cannot be cached.
+   */
+  boolean isDynamic();
+
+  /** Don't cache if {@link #isDynamic()}. If not dynamic, the state parameter can be ignored. */
+  List<BaggageField> currentFields(@Nullable S state);
+
+  /** Don't cache if {@link #isDynamic()}. */
+  boolean handlesField(BaggageField field);
+
+  /**
+   * Gets the value of this field in the given state.
+   *
+   * @see BaggageField#getValue(TraceContext)
+   * @see BaggageField#getValue(TraceContextOrSamplingFlags)
+   */
+  @Nullable String getValue(BaggageField field, S state);
+
+  /**
+   * Creates a state object to support the first field value.
+   *
+   * @see BaggageField#updateValue(TraceContext, String)
+   * @see BaggageField#updateValue(TraceContextOrSamplingFlags, String)
+   */
+  S newState(BaggageField field, String value);
+
+  /**
+   * Updates a state object to handle a field value change.
+   *
+   * @see BaggageField#updateValue(TraceContext, String)
+   * @see BaggageField#updateValue(TraceContextOrSamplingFlags, String)
+   */
+  S mergeState(S state, BaggageField field, @Nullable String value);
